moduleTitle: L1 Deep Dive Module 7: Longevity Science & The Sustain Pillar

questions.question: In the context of 'Inflammaging,' what is the primary mechanism that contributes to the acceleration of age-related systemic decline?
options: Acute inflammatory responses to bacterial infection
Chronic, low-grade, sterile systemic inflammation
The complete cessation of cytokine production
Rapid regeneration of T-cell populations in the thymus
questions.explanation: Inflammaging is defined as chronic, low-grade, sterile (non-infectious) inflammation that drives the aging process and increases the risk of age-related diseases.

questions.question: When assessing a senior dog using the DISHA acronym for Cognitive Dysfunction Syndrome (CDS), what does the 'H' specifically represent?
options: Hyperactivity and restlessness
Hearing loss and sensory decline
House-soiling or loss of previous house-training
Hunger and metabolic changes
questions.explanation: DISH(A) stands for Disorientation, Interactions, Sleep-wake cycle, House-soiling, and Activity changes.

questions.question: According to the lesson on Sarcopenia, what is a critical nutritional requirement for senior pets to prevent muscle wasting, assuming no renal contraindications?
options: Reducing protein intake to 15% to protect the kidneys
Increasing high-quality protein intake to compensate for reduced anabolic sensitivity
Eliminating all fats to prevent pancreatitis
Focusing exclusively on fiber for digestive motility
questions.explanation: Senior pets often require higher levels of high-quality protein (amino acids) to maintain lean muscle mass because their bodies become less efficient at protein synthesis (anabolic resistance).

questions.question: A 12-year-old Labrador presents with difficulty rising and 'bunny hopping' on stairs. Which supplement has the strongest evidence-based meta-analysis support for reducing joint inflammation in dogs with Osteoarthritis?
options: Vitamin C
Glucosamine hydrochloride alone
Omega-3 fatty acids (specifically EPA and DHA)
Calcium carbonate
questions.explanation: Omega-3 fatty acids, specifically EPA and DHA, have the most robust clinical evidence for reducing inflammation and improving mobility in dogs with OA.

questions.question: In Stage 2 and Stage 3 Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), what is the primary dietary modification proven to extend survival time in feline and canine patients?
options: Sodium loading
Dietary phosphorus restriction
Increasing carbohydrate intake
Eliminating all moisture from the diet
questions.explanation: Restricting dietary phosphorus is the cornerstone of renal diets and has been clinically shown to slow the progression of CKD and improve survival times.

questions.question: How can a practitioner distinguish between Lenticular Sclerosis and Cataracts during a physical evaluation of a senior dog?
options: Lenticular Sclerosis is always painful, while cataracts are not
Cataracts are clear, while Lenticular Sclerosis is opaque
Lenticular Sclerosis is a normal aging change that allows light to reach the retina; cataracts block light
There is no difference; they are two names for the same condition
questions.explanation: Lenticular Sclerosis is a normal age-related hardening of the lens that looks cloudy but remains transparent to light, whereas cataracts are pathological opacities that impair vision.

questions.question: The 'HHHHHMM' Quality of Life Scale is used to objectively evaluate hospice patients. What do the two 'Ms' represent?
options: Muscle mass and Metabolism
Mobility and More good days than bad
Memory and Mood
Medication and Maintenance
questions.explanation: The HHHHHMM scale (by Dr. Alice Villalobos) stands for Hurt, Hunger, Hydration, Hygiene, Happiness, Mobility, and More good days than bad.

questions.question: Studies on mitochondrial dysfunction in aging pets suggest that which of the following acts as a 'mitochondrial cofactor' to improve cellular energy production?
options: L-Carnitine and Alpha-lipoic acid
Simple glucose polymers
Insoluble cellulose
Synthetic Vitamin K
questions.explanation: L-Carnitine and Alpha-lipoic acid work synergistically to support mitochondrial function and reduce oxidative stress at the cellular level.

questions.question: Which specific statistic regarding Cognitive Dysfunction Syndrome (CDS) was highlighted in the module to emphasize the importance of early screening?
options: Only 1% of dogs over 10 years old develop CDS
Approximately 28% of dogs aged 11–12 years show at least one sign of CDS
Cats are immune to cognitive decline
CDS only affects small breed dogs
questions.explanation: Research indicates that approximately 28% of dogs aged 11–12 years and 68% of dogs aged 15–16 years show at least one clinical sign of CDS.

questions.question: What is the primary role of Silymarin (Milk Thistle) in supporting the 'Sustain' pillar for hepatic health?
options: It acts as a sedative to prevent liver stress
It increases bile duct obstruction to concentrate enzymes
It provides antioxidant support and promotes protein synthesis for hepatocyte regeneration
It replaces the need for dietary protein entirely
questions.explanation: Silymarin is a flavonoid that provides potent antioxidant effects, inhibits inflammatory pathways, and stimulates ribosomal RNA protein synthesis to help regenerate liver tissue.
